triples.name: Event-driven architecture
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel event-triggered scheme for control systems to replace traditional time-triggered mechanisms.

triples.name: Markov chain
triples.relevance: Semi-Markovian switching systems form the mathematical foundation for modeling the system dynamics.

triples.name: Cyber-physical system
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control challenges specific to cyber-physical systems with network connectivity and security threats.

triples.name: Man-in-the-middle attack
triples.relevance: False data injection attacks are a type of security threat related to compromised data communication in networked systems.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov-Krasovskii functional and stability analysis are core mathematical tools used to prove finite-time stability criteria.

triples.name: Linear matrix inequality
triples.relevance: LMI framework is used to formulate and solve the optimization problem for designing the finite-time controller.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Finite-time stability control is a control theory approach that ensures system convergence within finite time.

triples.name: Vertical takeoff and landing
triples.relevance: Vertical take-off and landing helicopter model serves as the practical application example to validate the proposed control scheme.

triples.name: Delay differential equation
triples.relevance: Network-induced delays are modeled using delay differential equations in the closed-loop system model.
